div3.head:
By Thomas W. Keesee, Auctioneer,
(Office corner of Twelfth and Cary streets.)
div3.p: Valuable Household and Kitchen Furniture and Piano For Sale at Auction.--Will be sold on Wednesday morning, September 14th, commencing at 10 o'clock, at the residence of Mrs. Rebecca Jones, on Broad street, between Seventeenth and Eighteenth streets, Household and Kitchen Furniture, consisting in part of
Also,
125 bushels of Coal and about one cord of Wood.

div3.head: By L. H. Luck, Auctioneer.
div3.p: I shall, on Tuesday, the 13th instant, sell a fine assortment of Furniture, such as

list.item: Several good Gold and Silver Watches,

div3.p:
Goods will be received until 9 o'clock on the day of sale.
Quick sales and prompt returns.
div3.closer:
L. H. Luck, Auctioneer,
No. 86 Main street. se 12

div3.head:
By George W. Willis, Auctioneer,
(no. 63 Main street.)
div3.p: Will be sold at Auction, at my Store, on Tuesday, September 13th, at 10 o'clock, a desirable lot of
Also,
Several fine Gold and Silver Watches,
Two Sewing Machines, in good order.

div3.head: By James M. Taylor, Auctioneer.
div3.p:
House and Lot, and one Vacant Lot, on Marshall street, For Sale at Auction.--Will be sold on Tuesday, the 13th day of September, on the premises, at 4½ o'clock P. M., the Brick Tenement on the north side of Marshall street, near its intersection with Munford street, and at present occupied by Mr. Alley.
The house contains six rooms, and has a large garden attached.
The lot fronts forty-five feet and runs back one hundred and eighty-five feet.
After the above, will be sold a Vacant Lot adjoining, fronting thirty feet on Marshall street, and running back one hundred and eighty-five feet.
Terms: Made known on the day of sale.

div3.head: Fifteen thousand Pounds of Bar Iron For Sale at Auction.
div3.p: --The undersigned Commissioners will sell at public auction, for cash, at Madison Courthouse, on Thursday, the 22d day of September, 1864, (court day,) in lots to suit purchasers,
15,000 Pounds Bar Iron,
suitable for Tires, &c. A part of the iron is one and a half inches by half an inch, and the residue is two inches by half an inch.
Also, a lot of Sheet Iron.

div3.head: Mayfield For Rent, about Six and a half miles from the City of Richmond.
div3.p:
--If not disposed of privately before Monday, the 19th instant, I will rent, at public auction, on the premises, on that day, my Farm, in the county of Hanover, near Mechanicsville, containing two hundred acres of land.
There is on the place a good dwelling house, besides all the necessary out-houses.
Apply to George K. Crutchfield, Richmond, or to myself, in Hanover.

div3.head: Valuable Farm of one hundred and fifty-one acres, on the Mechanicsville turnpike, three and a half miles from the City, For Rent at Auction.
div3.p:
--Will be rented out, on the premises, at public auction, on Friday, the 16th September, at 5 o'clock P. M., the Farm formerly occupied by Mrs. Braxton, now in the occupancy of Mrs. J. J. Fry.
It has a very handsome Dwelling and all the necessary out-buildings.
The land is rich, a part well adapted to grass, and the balance fine vegetable land.
The garden is productive, and there is an excellent orchard.
The place is well watered and healthy.
Terms: Payable quarterly in advance.

div3.head: Valuable property For Rent.
div3.p: On Monday, the 3d of October next, in Charlottesville, at 11 o'clock, in front of the court-house, I will proceed to rent out the following-described property:

list.item:
1st.
The Central Hotel, for three years from 1st January next.

2d.
Rock Hill, adjacent to town, containing about seventy-five acres; comfortable dwelling, &c. This property is rented from 1st October, so that wheat, oats, &c., can be seeded.

3d.
A dwelling in town, containing ten or twelve rooms, with store attached, containing six or seven rooms.

4th.
A house adjacent to the railroad office, containing eight or ten rooms.

5th.
A slate-colored Frame House near the depot, with eight or ten rooms.

6th.
A small House, and new Stable containing ten or twelve stalls.

7th.
A first-rate Garden of about an acre.

div3.p: Also, a valuable House and Lot of ten acres, of highly-improved Land, in Warren; and, perhaps, my Farm, Mill and Residence, near Scottsville.
Possession given to all on the 1st of January, except the farm Rock Hill, which is at once.

div3.head: Administratrix's Sale.
div3.p:
--Will be sold on the premises of the late Henry W. Fisher, in Chesterfield county, on Thursday, the 15th of September, Household and Kitchen Furniture, Farming Implements, Horses, Cows, Sheep, Hogs, etc. Three or four of the Cows have young calves, and are excellent milkers.
Also, one 2-horse Carriage, one Buggy, one Cart, and one or two Wagons.
Sale to commence at 10 o'clock A. M.
Terms: Made known on the day of sale.
div3.closer:
Eliza A. Fisher,
Administratrix. se 3--eod3t

div3.head: For Sale.
div3.p:
--I desire to sell, privately, about six hundred cords of Seasoned Oak Wood, situated in the county of Fluvanna, about one-quarter of a mile from the canal.
Address "Box 295," Richmond, Virginia.

div3.head: By James M. Taylor, Auctioneer.
div3.p:
House and Lot For Rent at Auction, and A Vacant Lot For Sale at Auction.--Will be rented out, on Monday, the 12th day of September, on the premises, at 12 o'clock M., the Brick Tenement on Brook Avenue, between Clay and Leigh streets. It contains five rooms, and is at present occupied by Colonel Vaules.
Possession given on the 10th instant.
After the renting of the above, I will sell a Vacant Lot on Leigh, near Henry street. The lot fronts fifty feet on Leigh street, and runs back the usual depth.

div3.head: By Redwood, Phillips & Co., Auctioneers.
div3.p: We will Sell at Auction on Monday Next, at 10 o'clock, an assortment of Household and Kitchen Furniture, consisting of

div3.head: Very likely and Valuable free negroes For Sale at Auction.
div3.p:
--In pursuance of an order of the Hustings Court of the city of Richmond I will sell, in front of the City Hall, on Monday, the 12th day of September, 1864, at 10 o'clock A. M. precisely, to the highest bidder, for cash, James Harris, Charles Harris and George Drew, free negroes, young and very likely, and ordered by said court to be sold into absolute slavery.
Also, Isaiah, a slave, committed to jail as the property of William Spyers; and Barney, a small boy, committed as the property of George S. Palmer — committed as runaways, and ordered to be sold as such.
div3.closer:
Thomas U. Dudley,
Sergeant of the City of Richmond. se 9--3t

div3.head: Valuable Farm and Mill For Sale.
div3.p:
--"Forge Mills," situated on the Chickahominy.--The above desirable Farm, Mill, &c., containing 1,400 acres, with all appurtenances.
For particulars, &c., apply to
div3.closer:
R. G. Farley,
At A. Farley & Co's,
Cary, between Eleventh and Twelfth streets.
Terms: $250,000 cash. se 12--2t

div3.head: Valuable Farm of two hundred and fifty-nine and a half acres, in Warwick county, on the James river, For Sale privately.
div3.p:
--We offer for sale, privately, the Farm located as above.
It contains two hundred and fifty-nine and a half acres; of which one hundred is cleared and of good soil; one hundred in timber, of good quality, the remainder in marsh, well suited for raising cattle and hogs; fish and oysters convenient and plentiful.
The improvements are a dwelling, with five rooms besides basement, and all the buildings necessary for servants and the farm.
This farm is offered by a refugee, who sells not from choice, but necessity.
For terms and further particulars apply to

Farm For Sale, in the county of Charles City, twenty-two miles from Richmond, containing four hundred and twenty-five acres; only fifty cleared; the balance in wood and timber.
It has a good house, with four rooms and a wide passage, nearly new, cottage style.
The out-buildings are all good and convenient.
It will be sold low, and offers a good chance for investment.
For further particulars apply to
div3.closer:
J. M. Haines & Co.,
No. 6 Franklin street,
Near First Market. se 12--eod6t

div3.head: A Farm in Powhatan county For Sale privately.
div3.p: --A farm of one hundred acres of land, with the improvements, in Powhatan county, ten miles from Powhatan station, and two and a half miles from James river, for sale privately.

div3.head: Valuable Brick Tenement, with eight Rooms and Ample servants' Accommodations, on Fourth street, between Grace and Franklin streets, For Sale privately.
div3.p:
--I offer for sale, privately, the valuable Brick Tenement located as above, with immediate possession.
The location of the property and depth of lot, (being one hundred and sixty feet deep,) makes it very valuable.--For terms, apply to

For Sale, two Houses and Lots, on Twenty-ninth street, Church Hill--one now vacant.
Apply to W. H. Craig, upon the premises.

div3.head: Six hundred dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway from my stables, on the night of the 28th ultima, my two Negro men, named Albert and Henry.
Henry is about twenty-two or twenty-three years old, about five feet six inches high, black, and stammers very badly when talking.
Albert is about twenty years old, five feet seven inches high, bright mulatto, with smooth face and very large feet and hands.
I will pay the above reward for them, or three hundred dollars for either one, delivered to me at my stables, on Franklin street. They are evidently making their way to the Yankee lines.
div3.closer:
James C. Johnson,
Virginia Stables, Franklin street,
Richmond, Virginia. se 3--10t

div3.head: Two hundred dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ran away from the subscriber, about the 8th of last month, (August) a Negro Boy named Robert; about twenty-eight years old; five feet eleven inches high; black; fine set of teeth; rather inclined to be knock-kneed; quick spoken, and very active.
He had on when he left a brown jeans sack coat; his other clothing not recollected.
He was raised in Middlesex county.
I will give the above reward for his apprehension and delivery to me, or to Messrs. S. N. Davis & Co., of Richmond, or for his confinement in any jail so that I get him again.

div3.head: One hundred dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ran away, about the 1st of July, 1864, from J. A. Seay, to whom he was hired to work on the Danville railroad, my boy John, eighteen or twenty years old, five feet six or eight inches high, bright complexion, spare made, and very likely.
I will pay the above reward for his delivery to me or confinement in jail so I can get him.
div3.closer:
R. A. A. Watson,
Jennings's Ordinary Post office,
Nottoway county, Virginia. se 1--12t

div3.head: Co-Partnership.
div3.p:
--P. W. Grubbs and A. D. Williams, Auctioneers, have associated themselves under the firm and style of
Grubbs & Williams,
and propose to conduct the Real Estate Business therefore carried on by them separately.
Being the successors of Messrs. Goddin & Apperson, and having access to the books, maps and papers connected with their late business, they hope, with the counsel and advice of the old concern, and their own experience and facilities, to be better able than ever before to promote the interests of all who may confide business to their hands.
We will sell Real Estate at auction and private sale, in town and country; rent out houses, and do everything appertaining to a general Real Estate Business.
Office on Main street, next door below Bank of Virginia.

For Sale, the good-will and Fixtures of the American Billiard Saloon, under the American Hotel, corner of Main and Eleventh streets. The Fixtures consist of four Marble-Bed Billiard Tables (Phelan's patent), with the necessary Furniture.
This is the oldest establishment in the city, having a fine run of custom, and is only sold on account of the present proprietor being unable to give his undivided attention to the business.
For terms, apply on the premises.

div3.head: Notice.
div3.p:
--Commandants and others of the army and navy will please pay attentions to the notice already given that arrangements have been made for a steamer to leave Rocketts Daily at 7 o'clock A. M. and 4 o'clock P. M., for the purpose of towing barges and taking to Drewry's Bluff quartermaster and commissary stores and other articles for the army and navy.
Except in cases of emergency, steamers will not be furnished at other hours.
div3.closer:
John H. Parker,
Lieutenant in charge office Special Service,
Navy Department. ja 24--ts

div3.head: Notice to Tax-Payers.
div3.p:
--I shall remain at my office in the County Courthouse daily from 9 o'clock A. M. to 5 P. M. until the 25th day of the present month, (September,) to receive the Taxes levied by the Court to purchase provisions for the suffering poor of the county.
It is very desirable to realize the amount at once that the purchases may be made during the early fall.
div3.closer:
George D. Pleasants,
Sheriff of Henrico county. se 8--ts

div3.head: Wood Carding.
div3.p:
--The Scottsville Manufacturing Company, Albemarle county, Virginia, has now in full operation machinery for Carding Wool Rolls for the country in the very best manner.
The wool must be clean washed, picked free from bars, and greased well.
Thirty to forty pounds an hour, and no delay for an ordinary quantity.
div3.closer:
John S. Martin,
Secretary, &c se 5--6t

div3.p: Just received, thirty dozen fine Regatta Shirts, fast colors; also, fifteen groes Ivory Buttons, suitable for Ladies' Overcoats; Black Worsted Binding; Gilt and Plated Trimming Buttons, etc.
div3.closer:
John Hartz,
Eighth street, between Broad and Grace, near the Fredericksburg Depot, Richmond, Virginia. se 7--1v
